name: 霍弘毅
objective: This will be a course in Orientalism and Occidentialism, or, if you prefer, “Cross-cultural miscommunication”.  Through both popular and “serious” films, essays, and media we will look at the West looking at the East, and look at the East looking at the West.  The goal will be to become articulate about the way the West in particular mythifies and stereotypes both the near and far east by studying the films Keys of the Kingdom; M Butterfly; 300; L’amant; Horoshima, Mon Amour; The Last Samuri; Memoirs of a Geisha; Brokeback Mountain, and reading Roland Barthes Empire of signs as well as selected texts by Edward Said and Gayatri Spivak.
